inn1.comm: swing right away, Guptill flicks it off the pads to square leg
swings down the leg side, called a wide
more swing, Guptill plays around his front leg, driving it to mid-on
clipped away off the pads, gets a single wide of square leg
gets right behind this angled delivery and defends
too much wing down the leg side for a diving Parthiv Patel
moves a long way across, Zaheer gets the swing, and an inside edge perhaps saves him
angled across him, left alone
starts off with a big wide down the leg side. looking for too much outswing perhaps
in swinger this time, too straight, and Guptill clips it away nicely through midwicket

poor start from Praveen, but credit to Guptill for latching into those opportunities. PL tries the outswinger this time, but he starts too straight again, and Guptill directs it wide of midwicket again
better line, around off, defended back to him
stays around off again, gets a thick inside edge that evades the stumps
McCullum is off and running! Calculated risk, charges at PK, makes room, doesn't get hold of it, but goes ahead with the shot, with one hand over the covers field. What a way to get off the mark
back of a length, McCullum stays in the crease and defends
length ball, around off, defended to cover
hint of moving across too far with the ball holding its line a bit as opposed to going with the angle. However, Guptill does well to recover and defend it back to Zaheer
slightly fuller, around off, defended to cover
well bowled, seaming away after pitching around off. It is not just the angle, but seam movement away from him. Beaten
too wide outside off, a diving Parthiv fumbles, letting them take a bye too
defends a fullish ball off the back foot. Not much feet
Slap! Don't bother with technique here. Just stands deep in the crease and drills a length ball between the bowler and mid-off

lovely on-drive on the up, but Gambhir has placed himself straight at mid-on, and makes a good, diving save too. And Bangalore is not the best place to dive, it is a bumpy, at times dangerous, outfield
back of a length, around off, pushed back to him
stays back and defends a straight delivery to midwicket
looks to sweep this one! Yes, sweep! Connects well, but finds square leg
flicked away with the angle, and unluckily he finds Nehra at short fine leg
pushed to mid-on to end the first over without a wide
back of a length, on the pads, drops and runs, past midwicket, takes an easy single
Another bosh! McCullum is feeling good today. Dances down the track as if to a spinner, makes room, and crashes him past extra cover. NZ's best start so far
full and straight, defended back to him
and comes down the track again, Zaheer follows him and sort of cramps him up, and the shot doesn't find the power or the gap
lovely slower offcutter, beats him outside off. BMac is smiling
length ball, middle and leg, tries to go behind the leg gully but finds him
length ball around off, defended to cover
slower ball, Guptill doesn't recover, ends up throwing his arms at it, but the thick top edge falls safe, short of third man
guided to third man along the ground this time

Parthiv has had a rough ride back to international cricket! After all those wides, BMac goes for the McScopp this time, blindsighting Parthiv. Praveen beats McCullum with the slower ball, but Parthiv is hit flush in the hip
this is somewhat reminiscent of McCullum's crazy hitting in the first IPL match ever, at the same venue. Hit over mid-on for six
the thick outside edge goes to third man for one
looks to move across to open the leg side where there is no file leg or square leg. Zaheer bowls wide of off, McCullum defends
another charge down the wicket, another slash, but he gets a bottom edge that bounces off towards the keeper
accurate, no room, pitches middle, angles towards off, defended to cover
another charge down the pitch, Zaheer goes wide of off, McCullum slashes at it, hitting it straight to mid-off
goes for the cut, staying put in the crease for a change, is beaten by the angle
and what a lovely classical shot! Just a step down the wicket, getting right down to the pitch of the ball, and driving it between the bowler and mid-on. Beautiful
and he pushes a single to long-on right away
tries the reverse sweep, is beaten, but it is turning too far down the leg side. They take the leg-bye
full delivery driven down to long-on for another single

"Catch it" is the call, but Ashwin will be pleased he is alive. He charged at him again, converting this into a half-volley, and bludgeoned it back at Ashwin, who went down to save his head and then raised his arm to see if it sticks. It doesn't. It goes screaming away for four
reverse-swept from outside leg, finds point
and they are flowing freely here. Hit over and wide of mid-on. Another bowler has been welcome to the crease with a four
similar delivery, outside off, though, defended to cover
drags this from wide of off, in the air, wide of mid-on. Gambhir puts in a desperate dive there, and gets in only close enough to get a finger nail to it

Gone! Too adventurous? Third aerial shot in the over. two of those were wide enough of mid-on, but this delivery was even wider, making him go into the crowded off side. Guptill went with the drive, and found Yuvraj Singh at cover
and How walks down the track first ball, getting too close to a length ball, and defending it back to the bowler
flashy drive outside off, gets a single off the thick outside edge
back of a length, turning in, defended towards short midwicket
paddled fine, fine enough of long leg to come back for two
worked around the corner for one
Shot! The McSweep! The reverse-sweep with knees hardly bent. Right off the middle of the bat, past point
sees him coming and fires it down the leg side, McCullum covers the line and lets it hit him on the pad
pitched up around leg, it is the straighter delivery, and McCullum gives it the deserved respect

No. 2 for Nehra in his second over. How, who looked loose outside off during the short stay, succumbs. It is a regulation delivery angled across him, but How hangs his bat out, away from the body. The edge is taken, and snapped low by Yusuf Pathan at a wide first slip
moves across to cover the line of this, and drives this to mid-on
thick edge outside off, goes to point. Taylor is moving across along the crease
lets this one alone outside off
another leave outside off
this is straighter, middle and leg, beats Taylor's attempted flick. A wicket-maiden
slower in the air, turning in sharply, McCullum hit on the pad
clipped away with the turn, and rushes back for the second! And this, ladies and gentleman, is the first time McCullum has run for his runs today
tossed-up delivery, defended to midwicket
sees him coming down, bowls down the leg side, McCullum covers the line with the pad, and then works it away for a single
turned away to square leg
edged just wide of slip! Nice drift there, drawing him to play away from the body, then taking a thick edge, but it eludes the outstretched hand of first slip
comes down the track and drives it after making room, but finds cover

Shot! He keeps manufacturing them. He had made his mind up that this one had to go. Just stood back, cleared the front leg, and it didn't matter this was a shortish delivery. He still went over mid-off, and cleared him with ease
gives him the charge and makes room, Nehra follows him with a short delivery, McCullum manages to get it only as far as point
lucky runs there. McCullum makes room again, Nehra chases him again, cramping him up, but the bottom edge goes flying across the bumpy outfield for four
stays put this time, Nehra bowls short, just outside off, and McCullum pushes it to cover

Nehra is celebrating here, but umpire Saheba has called it a wide. Drama. Nehra digs this one short, McCullum gets inside the line and pulls. Nehra is so sure he has edged it he starts celebrating. Only to turn around and see that it has been called a wide. Doesn't seem to be a clear edge or a noise on this one. Perhaps slight deviation
connects on the pull this time, keeping it along the ground, for a single
swept away. Nice, juicy full toss, and he happily accepts four more
big, big wicket! McCullum was looking very good here. He tried to go over short midwicket here, but got too close to this full delivery, thus not getting enough elevation. Ashwin is jubilant
starts off with an easy single to long-on
moves across to defend this into the leg side
flat outside off, pushed back to the bowler
wide down the leg side, turning past the across-moving Taylor
driven down to long-on for one
left alone outside off
pushed off the pads, gets a single to wide of midwicket
cut away to sweeper-cover for one
back of a length, pushed back to Nehra
good-looking drive from Taylor, gets a single to sweeper-cover
angled across him, left alone
pushed to long-on for a single
flighted delivery, gets an inside edge onto the pad. the drift made him play away from the body
flicked away past square leg for one
nicely tossed up outside off, defended back to him
shorter and flatter, gets a single to long-on
flighted delivery around off, hit back to Ashwin
pushes a length ball down to long-off for one
full and wide, Styris goes for a square-drive away from the body. Is beaten
appeal for leg-before as Styris is hit right in front of stumps, looking to turn it to leg side. However, with no swing, this had to be pitched outside leg if it was hitting the stumps
seems to have moved too far across, just about manages to get the bat down in time
looks for the cut, gets a bottom edge towards point
flicked away off the pads, wide of deep midwicket
shortish, around off, pushed to extra cover
fuller, closer to off, driven to the right of extra cover, but Yuvraj does the fielding
well bowled. Legcutter that starts middle and off and leaves him, hitting him on the back pad, outside off
slight shimmy down the wicket, but PK bowls well, doesn't go off his plan of bowling just short of length, around off. Styris can't beat midwicket
fuller, outside off, pushed square to point
and he undoes a good over with a poor delivery angling down the leg side. Styris is too accomplished an ODI player to not punish it, clipping it fine for four

beautiful cover-drive, down on a knee, lovely follow through, and then through the gap between mid-off and extra cover. The front foot travelled well to cover the line, and the ball met the middle of the slightly open bat
pulls the length back a bit, Taylor pushes him to cover
angled across him, and left alone
punched to extra cover, can't find the gap
moving across again, Nehra slows it down a touch, Taylor recovers well and pushes it to mid-off with soft hands
worked away off the hip for a single

Both Yuvraj and Styris are diving here. Styris drops it towards covers and sets off for a run. Taylor sends him back. Yuvraj makes a diving underarm throw. Styris dives to make it back. And then takes an overthrow
pushed wide of mid-off for one
flicked away off the pads
moves across to off, pushes a length ball back to the bowler
stays put now, and clips it to long leg for one
back of a length, pushed to long-off for one
driven with an open face, gets a single to deep point
wants a single after dropping it with soft hands towards point. Styris sends him back, Taylor is not happy. Lots of hand-waving
angled across, left alone
defended back to the bowler
worked away off the pads
cut away to deep point
steered down to third man for another single
looks to manufacture the cut, and is beaten because it is not short enough
gets a thick edge for a single to third man
moves across to drag this from wide outside off, ends up playing it to mid-on
driven on the up, high elbow and all, gets a single to sweeper-cover
again Taylor plays a horizontal-bat shot to a ball not short enough. This time, he is beaten on the pull from outside off
flicked away from outside off to long leg for one
angled across him, pushed to the straight extra cover
pitched middle and leg, angling across, Taylor defends towards point
appeal for lbw as Taylor moves too far across. Again, no swing, and hence pitched outside leg
length ball, around off, pushed back to Zaheer
on middle and leg this time, pushed towards midwicket
length ball, around off, pushed back to PK
moves across, and takes it from off to flick it towards square leg for one
holding its line outside off, Taylor defends it back to PK
again moves along the crease to get inside the line of this, and clips it wide of mid-on
driven on the up, good-looking stroke, but finds extra cover
pulled away, quick to pick the length, rocks back and places it over midwicket
flighted outside off, driven to cover-point
flatter, pushed to long-off for one
driven to sweeper-cover for one
swept away to deep square leg
sees him charge down the wicket, bowls it flat, Styris plays it back
cut away for a single
short, sharp offbreak, pushed back to the bowler
slower in the air, Styris comes down the pitch, but gets too close to it, and pushes it back to the bowler
driven down to long-on for one
worked away around the corner for one
comes down the track to drive this to long-on, along the ground
short, turning in, worked away with the spin
swept from wide outside off for a single to long leg
full toss, driven to long-off for one
tossed up around off, pushed back to him
good shot, powerful sweep from well outside off, all along the ground, finds the gap between fine leg and deep square leg
looks to work this to leg, slight turn there, and it gets a leading edge that falls short of the bowler
not quite short enough, but he has pulled it between long-on and deep midwicket for two
fiighted delivery around off, pushed back to Yusuf
driven down to long-on for one
turning down the leg side, helped away for a single
sharp offbreak on the pads, played to square leg
comes down the track and chips this over the infield on the leg side. He was beaten in the flight, but recovered well to exploit the field
turning into the pads, turned around the corner
looks to cut it, but doesn't get it past point
lovely shot, coming down the track, making some room to free his arms, and lofting him over his head. Never looked to hit it hard, almost a chip
guides this behind square on the off side for one
presses forward and defends this around his front pad
moves across, then sees he is too far inside the line, goes back, and works it into the on side for one
driven to sweeper-cover for one
worked away off the pads for another single
another lovely chip shot! Always looking for the placement once he got close to the pitch of this delivery, lofting him over midwicket
flatter, into the pads, pushed to midwicket
he is gone! Goes for the same chip over midwicket, but the ball is a bit too straight, and is also turning in, which makes him drag it a bit squarer than he wants and he finds Tiwary on the boundary

big shout for lbw as Taylor moves too far across and is beaten by the offbreak. Pitched outside off, turning in towards middle and leg. Looks pretty adjacent. perhaps the height saved him. He was hit on the knee roll, on the front foot
turned away with the spin for a spin
flighted around off, defended back to him
shortish, pulled away, Yuvraj misfields at square leg, conceding a single
outside edge right away, playing away from the body, takes the edge with the turn, and it goes fine for four
flat, short, hit back to the bowler

big, unrelenting shout for lbw, this goes with the arm, bat and pad are close together, there are two obvious sounds, but Sharma thinks it's pad first, in which case it should be a plumb lbw. And replays show it indeed was pad first
flighted around off, defended back to the bowler
that lbw shout last over doesn't stop Taylor from shuffling across. He gets inside the line of this and works it fine of fine leg for two
opens the face on this one for a single
pushed back to the bowler
opens the face on this one, gets it wide of deep point and comes back for two
looks to sweep but is beaten. However, the soft impact of the pads allows them to come back for two before it reaches fine leg
driven down to long-off for one
flighted delivery, driven down the ground, between long-on and long-off, and they take two
left alone outside off
chips down the track, Rohit follows him, Franklin defends it back
pushed to long-off for one
worked around the corner for one
driven straight to extra cover
shuffles across to get inside the line, and works it to long leg for one
driven down to long-off for another single
swept fine from outside off, they think of two but don't take on Zaheer's throw
pitched up outside leg, turning towards middle, defended to cover
again, pitched on leg, defended back to Yusuf
slips while looking to sweep this, but gets it fine, gets himself up, and takes the single
pushed wide of point for a single
driven with the turn, Kohli makes a diving save at midwicket
and he finds midwicket again with a punch
uppish shot, towards midwicket again, Taylor needs to hit somewhere else
swept away from outside off, gets a single to deep square leg
punched away square, gets a single to sweeper-cover
pushed in front of his body, towards extra cover
beaten on the sweep, but the lbw shout is not big because it is pitched outside leg
again playing a bit too much in front of his body, hitting it uppishly towards the bowler
the lap sweep this time breaks the shackles, finding the gap between deep square leg and fine leg
and that sweep on the last ball has got him two boundaries. As expected, Pathan bowled this short and flat, and Franklin was waiting for it, cutting it between short third and point
pushed to extra cover
low full toss, worked away for a single into the on side
punched to point, says no the single
delays the shot this time to beat the point fielder, and gets a single
short-arm pull, this was only slightly short and he was quick to pounce on it. Gets just a single to deep square leg
it's amazing how he gets all this power into these gentle sweeps! Almost a lap sweep, and it goes screaming across the outfield, beating fine leg
outside off, pushed square to point

plumb lbw first ball! A nothing shot really! Moves too far across, and also seems to have told himself to not play the forceful shot first ball. And the bat face closes too early, missing the ball, and he is caught dead in plumb. Tame end to what was shaping up to be an important innings of struggle followed by flourish
tossed up outside leg, turning away, defended
stops in the delivery stride, deosn't stop Vettori from late-cutting this past Zaheer at point. Zaheer chased hard, thought of diving, but knows the bumpy outfield too well
tossed up around middle and leg, worked wide of mid-on for one
drives a full delivery to wide of long-off for one
sees the quicker ball, opens the face late, but is in the danger of playing that  one on. Finally, does manage to get a single to short third man
length ball into the pads, worked away for one. There are two men in the deep on the on side
goes for the drive outside off, gets an inside edge onto the pads. The back spin threatens to take it onto the stumps, but he keeps it out
lovely square-drive, gets the width and goes at it with an open face. Lovely timing, and wide of point
ordinary delivery, nice shot. Length ball, into the pads, with just a deep square leg the only deep fielder on the on side. He gets it wide of midwicket and comes back for three
short of a length, outside off, Vettori gets a thick edge towards point
driven with an open face, gets a single to the square third man
looks to drive this into the off side, from outside leg, gets an inside edge onto the pads
this one dips at him, and he has to wait for it to arrive. The late-cut doesn't find the gap
opens the face in front of stumps, gets a single to short third man
tossed up outside leg, turning towards off, gets a thick edge towards point
flatter, pushed to long-off for one
slow, on the pads, clipped away for one
steered down to third man for a single that brings Franklin on strike
punched to cover, but doesn't find the gap
full, on the pads, easy pickings for Franklin who is playing an important innings here. Places it wide of midwicket, and times it well
length ball outside off, gets a singe to extra cover
moves across to open up the leg side, Nehra bowls wide outside off, and Vettori can't do much else than defending it back

I heard something there! Vettori moved across again, Nehra bowled wide again, Vettori opened the face this time, and missed. No appeal from anywhere, but there seemed to be a sound as the ball passed the bat
full delivery, can't get it past mid-off

unorthodox but elaborate! Shows him a forward movement early, Ashwin drops it short and down the leg side, he arches back to make room and cuts it from way down the leg side, between short third and point
tries the same shot again, but it is too full for him
the nice, trusted slog gets him a single al along the ground
no slogging or cuteness to this shot. A good, old-fashioned loft over mid-on. Franklin is playing a beauty here
and there comes the gentle sweep, getting him the single
fast offbreak around the pads, defended back to YKP

Franklin nearly becomes the fourth man to get out in his forties today! Leading edge back towards the bowler, Yusuf has to run between the stumps and the non-striker, but loses his balance while attempting it, and drops him
swept fine for one
tries the reverse sweep, but gets a single off the back of the bat I presume because the umpire has not signalled leg-byes
driven to long-off for one
bowled him! Pathan is ecstatic. Vettori looks to pull this one from the leg-and-middle line, but it is not short enough. DV misses, YKP hits
angled into the pads, pushed back to Ashwin
cut away for one
defends an offbreak pitched on a length
fuller, defended back to him
carrom ball, opens the face and plays it with the spin for a single
flat offreak, punched back to the bowler
offbreak, around middle and leg, defended back
high back lift, Yusuf sees that and fires it in. Mills defends

No. 3 for YKP. He is over the moon. Mills goes for the big shot this time, the slog sweep, and Yusuf keeps firing them in. Mills misses, the ball hits the thigh pad outside the leg line, and then ricochets onto the stumps
moves across ala Taylor and defends this back to Pathan
NMac drives this to long-on for a single
offbreak around middle and leg, driven back to Yusuf
leading edge after having moved too far across, gets a single past point
cuts a length ball, fails to beat point

that fifty-jinx took some breaking! Nearly got out doing that! Came down the track, was beaten by the dip, got a thick edge, which cleared cover by inches. However, that doesn't take away for an important and a good innings. Two games ago he had zero fifties in ODIs, now he has two
flat delivery, pushed back to the bowler
guided behind square for one
beautiful shot, how good to watch that. Franklin comes down the track, makes room, and chips this over extra cover for a six. Lovely touch
sees him charge at him and fires it into his pads. NMac gets a single
superb timing again, flat, fast, leg-sidish, and he just clips it past midwicket. It just kept speeding away
worked around the corner for one
nice shot again, we are moving along now. McCullum charges at him, sees this fired down the leg side, covers the line, and then chips it wide of midwicket
shuffles across to work this to short fine for one
worked away off the pads for one
punched wide of Yusuf Pathan at sweeper-cover, and comes back for an eventually comfortable second. Although a quick, flat throw makes us go to the third umpire
misses out on a gentle full toss, hitting it down to long-on for one
gets a leg-bye as he fails to make connection on this leg-side delivery
lovely shot, lofting this length ball straight over Nehra's head. Simple technique, clearing the front foot to give him swinging space, and hits through the line
big wide down the leg side, Patel dives full length
yorker, hit softly towards long-on, and they take an easy second
another yorker, digs it out for a single to extra cover
and starts off with a slower bouncer, Franklin is early into the upper-cut
follows it up with a yorker, Franklin digs it out. The ball is bouncing over Zaheer, who parries it towards midwicket
makes room and drives a low full toss to long-on
slower ball, mcCullum mis-hits it short of long-on and come back for two
slower ball again, hit to long-on for one, along the ground
misfielded by Kohli at mid-ff. It was a powerful hit down the ground, Kolhi put in the dive to his left, but couldn't get there
yorker around off, gets the toe end for a single
Massive! Big big six. Shows him all three stumps, inviting him to follow him. It is a length ball, and Franklin goes big over the sight screen

What a shot! He has hit a short delivery over long-off for a six! Can he get to a hundred here? It has been a gem so far. Franklin makes room again, Nehra goes short, Franklin goes down the ground anyway. What timing. It clears long-off
Lovely final over for NZ. The hundred is very much on here! He makes room here, Nehra bowls a half-volley down the leg side, and he shovels it over midwicket

dropped! This is a high full toss on the stumps, which he lofts wide of long-off. Tiwary has to run in, and to his right, he gets under it with a slide, but the ball goes right thro8gh his hands, and what's more, for a four
he finally gets the yorker, and Franklin gets just a single to extra cover

inn2.comm: wide outside off, some shape in towards Gambhir, left alone
goes for the drive outside off, gets an inside edge onto the pad, takes a single to cover
angled outside off, left alone, called a wide. Harsh call
slight swing in towards PP, defended to cover
closer to off, but angling away, pushed with an open face
length ball, around off, defended towards cover
fuller, straighter, flicked to mid-on
swing there, but too full, and Gambhir drives it to extra cover
angled across him, and left alone
length ball, swinging in, gets an inside edge onto the pad
overpitched, squirted past cover-point, the trademark open face of Patel carrying it for four. How puts in a desperate dive in the chase but to no avail
punched on the up, but straight to extra cover
shorter, played with the angle, gets a single to third man
length ball angled across him, hit towards cover
ordinary shot, just swings at this without any feet, is beaten outside feet
pushed to cover, slight swing in towards him
this one seams away from Patel, almost like an offcutter, beating Patel, who pushes at it away from his body
How saves four at point, diving to his right with hardly any reaction time
back of a length, punched to cover, ends a maiden over
tight, around off, defended with an open face
swing in towards him, Gambhir plays across the line, gets an inside edge onto the pad
pushed to short cover - nine balls without a run
and Gambhir looks to manufacture something, walking down the pitch and dragging this into the on side. Good thing is, he keeps it down, and gets it past midwicket
bouncer, and Gambhir gets under it
punched away with an open face, can't get it past point
Gambhir wants the single, Patel refuses. This was pushed square, and was Gambhir's call
Patel breaks the shackles, coming down the track and crashing it over extra cover. it was a short delivery, and also gave him the room
slower ball, well bowled, offcutter, beating his drive outside off
solid pull shot, he has hit this out of his face, all along the ground, rolling his wrists on it, and beating the deep square leg
full and straight, hit back to Mills
hit off the inside half towards mid-on
clipped away off the pads for a single
throws his arms at it, gets a thick edge that flies over the slip. Safe shot
whipped away off the back foot. It was slightly short, and he sent it past midwicket for two
short, wide, and cut away fiercely, straight into Guptill at point. It is hit so hard it surprises Guptill, hits his body, and still goes for four
short and wide, cut away to cover-point. Patel is cross with himself for wasting that opportunity
another cut, this one falls short of slip and goes through for a single

another wristy flick, lovely timing, gets it past midwicket, but there is a lot more drama around! Vettori and Guptill chase, Vettori flicks it to Guptill, who sends the throw in towards the striker's end. It is a wide throw, McCullum has to go away and jump high to collect it. He flicks it when airborne, but misses the stumps. Gambhir, who is running with his head down, doesn't miss McCullum, almost spearing him. Everybody seems safe, though
pushed towards cover-point
played towards cover again
flicked past midwicket, comes back for two
edged, but no slip there! Gambhir cuts too close to the body and gets a regulation edge, but there is no slip, which just came out
looks to steer this pretty straight delivery, can't get it past point
guided to third man for one. Starts off with a short delivery, around off
beautiful cover-drive, Gambhir is not hurried at all playing this shot, leans into a wide delivery, opens the face, and finds the gap between cover and cover-point
that's pressure, ordinary delivery, angling down the leg side, with only a leg gully there. Gambhir places it wide of the fielder
clipped off the pads, runs hard, comes back for two. Soft hands, and hard yards
sees Gambhir charge at him and bounces him. Gambhir goes ahead with the shot, but is beaten
slower-ball wide down the leg side
full, into the pads, defended to mid-on
Patel is cutting them to pieces here. Gets the width and flays at it with all his might, going over point
pushed to mid-off, this was tighter
slower ball, middle and off, flicked to mid-on

it's slipping out of NZ's hands through the vacant slips. Another edge here as Parthiv swings at a length ball outside off, and the edge goes through where the wide slip would have been. Both the batsmen have edged one each through that region
misfied by Southee at short fine, single given away
makes room and cuts, but finds point
worked away off the pads for an easy single
slower offcutter, and this time Gambhir gets some luck going his way. The inside edge not only misses the stumps, it also eludes the diving McCullum, and beats the short fine leg
digs it in short seeing Gambhir walk down the track, but Gambhir clips it square for a couple
and what a way to get out after a missed run-out, an edge through slips! It was short, wide, juicy, and Gambhir has cut it straight to Guptill at point. Throat high. taken. Gambhir can't believe it
McKay has a spring in his step. Starts off with a bouncer to Kohli, who leaves it alone
wide down the leg side

McKay has two! Kohli is gone for a duck after having scored 50 or more in his four previous innings. McKay's energy shows as he bowls another bouncer, angled across Kohli, who goes for the hook, gets a chunky top edge to Mills at long leg. New Zealand are right back
angled across him, left alone
left alone again
thick edge, uppish, past point
cut away to deep point for one
punched away to mid-off
full, around off, defended solidly to mid-off
lovely straight drive, just a push really, between the bowler and mid-on. What timing. It races across
short, played with an open face towards point
short ball, tucks him up
driven to sweeper-cover for one
upper-cut over gully, good smart shot, takes a couple
classy drive! It was a half-volley all right, but Yuvraj made it look really good with that drive. On a knee he ended, the bat following through all the way to the back of hi right shoulder
slower ball, driven straight to mid-off
another cut shot, gets a single to square third man
drives away from the body, gets a thick edge wide of slip for a single
gets a leg-bye, having been beaten on the clip into the leg side
slower ball, Yuvraj gets an edge but it falls short of slip
another slower offcutter, squaring him up, beating him around off
shortish delivery, hit back to the bowler
flighted, driven to long-off for one
powerful drive, but hit straight to mid-on
pushed past point for one
flat delivery, played back to the bowler
slower in the air, goes for the drive, gets an inside edge onto the pad
starts with an offcutter, which is defended to cover
another accurate offcutter, no room at all
and again, the offcutter pitched around leg, turning towards off, pushed back to the bowler
and again, this is good bowling, no room, no pace
another offcutter but a touch wide, Yuvraj drives, gets a thick edge towards point
superb over, full of accurate slower offcutters, and is a maiden
cut to point, doesn't find the gap
slower through the air, defended back to the bowler
pitched up on middle and leg, pushed to midwicket
driven to sweeper-cover for one
cut away, but gets just the single
looks for the big, booming drive, is cramped for the room and gets an inside edge back towards the bowler
pushed down to long-off for a single
what a short-arm pull! This wasn't too short, Yuvraj just nonchalantly pulled it over midwicket. Lovely, sweet connection
fuller, and pushed to long-off for an easy single
that's a maiden fifty for PP! He has come back well, opening the innings, in a pressure chase. Pushes this down to long-off for another single, and the dressing room acknowledges his effort
slower ball on the pads, worked away for a single
another single to long-off
drives this down to long-on for one. Patel maja kare che
swept fine, comes back for two
full and fast, driven straight to extra cover
and just when he started looking good, Yuvraj is gone! Goes for the pull again to a ball that is not quite short, gets zero elevation and finds short midwicket
drives a low full toss to long-on to get off the mark right away
looks for the drive, ends up inside-halfing it to NMac

and he can't believe he has not got a wicket first ball. I can't believe it either, frankly. Arm ball. Sharma has hit the leather of the ball with an inside edge onto the pad, which has lobbed to McCullum. It is unbelievable Saheba missed that inside edge. And Vettori seems to be telling Saheba that if he thinks there is no inside edge, Sharma is caught dead plumb! Poor umpiring really
pushes this wide of cover for one
short ball, and pulled away for one
flighted delivery, defended back to him
played with an open face for a single
they go up to the third umpire for a stumping appeal, but Patel has slid his foot back in
drives a full toss to long-on for one
flat delivery, played back to the bowler

NMac is on fire here. Slows this one up, Patel comes down the track and goes for the big straight hit. Not quite close enough to the pitch of the ball and ends up skying it to long-on where substitute Williamson completes a tumbling catch
defended to square leg with a closed face
another defensive shot into the leg side
comes down the track, is beaten, hit in front, but that movement down the pitch saves him
pushed past extra cover to get off the mark
flat delivery, punched away for one
looks to drop and run but Guptill is alert at point
driven with an open face for a single
arm ball, angling down the leg side, hence a stifled appeal
pushed to extra cover, another dot
swept from middle and off for a single
defended back to the bowler
sharp turn there, and Vettori makes a diving save at square leg to save one run
flicked to long-on for one
worked around the corner for another single
played to backward square leg with the turn
turns this to square leg for one
that appeal is like a war cry, perhaps angling down the leg side, but Vettori is just playing mindgames with the umpire that denied him a wicket
lovely stuff from Sharam and Guptill. This was a nice chip shot over extra cover, and McCullum made a swimming-pool dive in the deep to save one run
pushed to cover
runs this past point for a single
flat delivery, cut away for a single
driven straight to extra cover
beautiful shot! Coming down the track, taking this at a half-volley, and lofting it back over McCullum's head, into the top tier
bowled slower and higher, defended towards midwicket
comes down the track again, realises he has got too close to it, and plays it along the ground to long-off
swept away to deep backward square leg
straighter one, well bowled, gets a thick outside edge, but it goes along the ground towards point
quick, around off, defended
played with soft hands into the on side where there is no midwicket. Vettori does the chasing, making sure they can't take two
short, pushed back to the bowler
driven down to long-off for one
slower through the air, defended with an open face
quicker, straighter one, Pathan is awake to that and pushes it back to Vettori
and is punched away for four first ball. Gives him the width, and Sharma punches with an open face, past point, and square of third man
slower ball, full, played back to McKay
pushed to point this time
another slower b all outside off, defended
short, pulled away off the hip to long leg
punched away, How makes a diving save at point, but they take a single
full, flat, around off, defended back to him
lovely flat six! Inviting him into a drive, Yusuf obliges, bludgeoning it over his head. It's ht so hard it breaks one of the boundary boards
pats this back to the bowler
defended to cover
plays this late, guiding it past cover for one
slower again, but short, and pushed down to long-on for one
what a misfield from Franklin. Driven straight to him at sweeper-cover, and the casual Franklin lets it slip through his hands. Three runs gifted
pulled towards midwicket, limp shot, but they take one
slower ball, defended towards the straight extra cover
slower bounces, Pathan shapes up for the pull but pulls out of it
length ball drilled back hard at it, McKay gets a hand to it, and gives Pathan the stare
another bouncer, called wide by Saheba from square leg
tucked away off the hip for a single
flat delivery, pushed to the straight extra cover
slows it down this time, Pathan stays back and punches it for one to sweeper-cover
played uppishly but wide of extra cover
pushed square, with an open face, finds point
quick delivery, into the pads, Pathan is hit on the pad
full delivery, driven to long-off for one
short, around off, punched away to sweeper-cover for one
nice pull shot, short ball, into the body, rolls his wrists on the shot, and beats fine leg
slower offcutter, Sharma defends
played with an open face, between point and cover-point, gets another single
that is a bouncer like he meant it, 135ks, and stingy, beating him on the pull
good response from Pathan, with the ball pitched up, he goes over mid-off and gets four. This chase is not over by a long way
angling down the leg side, flicked past short fine, comes back for two
arm ball, stifled shout because it is heading down the leg side
chip shot towards extra cover, but the long-off is wide and keeps them to one
Pathan is not for cute chips and all, he just makes up his mind and lofts a full ball over long-on. Clean strike
quicker, flatter, hits him on the pad but headed down the leg side
that's a more accurate arm ball, around off and middle, and Pathan stretches forward to defend
starts off with a shortish delivery, seaming in slightly, getting an inside edge onto the pad
lovely shot, picks the slower ball early, and plays the chip shot over extra cover. Just opened the stance slightly to give himself the room to swing the arms
another slower delivery, pushed down to long-on
short ball, and Pathan ducks under it
slower ball again, pushed to midwicket
bouncer at 132ks, pulled away to deep midwicket for one
pushes a single to cover-point
slower ball, pushed to extra cover
another slower ball, but this one doesn't break in, beating the outside edge
another slow ball, and hit uppishly, but wide enough of extra cover
wide down the leg side
nice shot, this was too full on the pads, between long-on and deep midwicket. Franklin and Southee just can't decide who should dive, and by the time Southee puts in the dive, it is too late
pushed past point for a single
shortish, tucked away for one

the crowd is stunned into silence! Slower ball, Sharma saw it early, and looked to go over mid-off, but ended up smashing it straight down his throat. Vettori did well to hold onto it because it was hit very hard at it. Just couldn't get the elevation there
and gets off with a couple first ball, tucking it off the pads
angled across him this time, pushed to cover-point
full ball, driven square to deep point for one
bouncer, and he ducks under it
offcutter, around middle and leg, turning away, defended towards cover
low full toss, punched to extra cover
too full again, driven to long-off for one
offcutter down the leg side, Pathan gets a tickle on it and gets four. In fact it went off the pad, but has been given runs
hit in the air towards deep midwicket, into the gap for two
pushes this offcutter down the ground for one
punched nicely off the back foot, wide enough of sweeper-cover to come back for two
tucks him up with a short delivery
bouncer, too high, and rightly called wide
slower ball, and Southee dives full length to his left to save one run. The Bangalore crowd appreciates it
another punch shot, gets a single to third man
shortish, pushed to point, no room
punches this short delivery to point
And Yusuf hoists this into the stands and rises his bat to acknowledge the crowd that has patiently waited for the last hour. First ball after rain break, and he just smacks it over long-on
and drops this into the leg side for one
drops and runs, quick work
another quick single, just wide of cover and they rush through
flat, into the pads, and they take a single to fine leg
sharp turn from just outside off, Pathan pokes at it, and is beaten
full ball, driven to long-off
flat from round the stumps, defended back to McCullum
big shout for lbw, Pathan misses on the sweep, and the ball has straightened a touch from round the stumps. Very good shout there, but not given
drilled wide of long-off where McKay makes a diving save to keep them down to two
cute shot, short, down the leg side, and he guides it past short fine leg, past the desperate diving attempt from How
and bunts this in front of square n the leg side to retain strike
slower ball, into the pads, Pathan takes a leg-bye
short ball with the third man in, but Tiwary can't get it past short third man

appeal for a catch down the leg side as he handcuffs Pathan with one angled into the ribs. The crowd cheers as Saheba calls it a wide. Mills tells him, it went over the leg stump. Well not quite, it was about two stumps' width down the leg side
this is good bowling, he has tucked Pathan again, who is inside the line this time
another short ball aimed for the ribs, Pathan gives him the charge and is beaten

can the auto-rickshaw drivers on the Cubbon Road return the ball please? That's a beastly hit, saw the slower ball early, perhaps he was expecting it, and just monstered it over cow corner. Onto the roof
yorker length, into the pads, worked away for a single
length ball, into the pads, worked away for one
that's a pull straight out of Tiwary school of batting, hit to mid-on. for no run
driven towards long-off for one
big appeal for lbw on this near-yorker, but it is clearly angling down the leg side
full ball, hit hard to long-on for one
yorker on the pads, they get a leg-bye
Tiwary tries the big hit after walking down the pitch, and is beaten by th short delivery
slower ball, not hit well, but they take a single to cover
yorker, concedes a leg-bye
slower ball, he has somehow managed to swat it to point for one - they have now put on 50 runs for the 6th wicket
low full toss on the pads, Taylor runs in from deep midwicket and completes that pick-up-and-throw in one motion to keep them down to one
slower ball, a full toss too, and he has hit it straight to midwicket
attempted yorker, turns out to be a low full toss, Pathan goes over extra cover, and gets a couple
misses the yorker length by inches, Pathan smashes it to deep midwicket for one
full delivery again, hit powerfully again, finds the straight extra cover
makes room and hits this low full toss straight to long-on, just the single
nearly a yorker outside off, slightly short of being one, drilled to cover, no run
the rare length ball, and he has cleared the front leg and swatted it to long-on for a single
length ball and Pathan is quick to capitalise, going inside-out, over extra cover
and Pathan is almost out, slogging at the slower ball, getting a top edge that eludes McKay, who runs backwards from short fine leg
length ball on the pads, poor execution, and Pathan flicks it wide of short fine for four crucial runs
and another poor delivery, is the ball wet? It is a full toss on the pads, and Yusuf has no trouble flicking it over the short fine leg. Not given no-ball, it was quite a high full toss
Length ball! Length ball! YKP is not going to have any mercy on those. Just clears the front leg and swings. The next thing we know the ball is in the stand behind midwicket
low full toss outside off, takes a single to retain strike
what a six! What a hundred! He removes the helmet, raises his arms, calmly soaks in the applause. This was short and he dismissed it, pulling it over wide long-on for sixth six
this one ha slipped out of his hand, too high, and thankfully it is wide of off. They get a bye too as it bounces in front of McCullum
and a wide this time, down the leg side
short ball, tucks him up, defended to cover

nothing going right for NZ. McKay beats him with a slower ball, but it bounces in front of McCullum and squeezes through his legs. MS Dhoni does the right thing in such cases, he stands upright and gets his pads together
defends a short ball into the off side
another slower ball outside off, Tiwary swings and misses
another slower delivery, played to point, no run
straight ball, around off, takes a singe to cover
full, on the pads, worked away for one
slogged along the ground, gets a single to deep midwicket
short and fast, pushed down to long-on for one
fired in, hits his pad, going down the leg side, though
quick into the pads again, worked away for a single
yorker on the pads, digs it out for one
low full toss on the pads, worked away to bring Pathan on strike
that's a good yorker, chasing Pathan's toe, getting a dot
another yorker, digs it out into the on side, and they come back for two. Southee has slipped as he tries to go for the ball
low full toss, hit towards long-on for one - it's now a 10-o-run stand, 73 of which Pathan has scored
good yorker, he keeps it out and takes a single to extra cover
comes down the track to take this one the full and muscle it to wide long-on for one
slog attempted, gets a thick inside edge that gets him a couple. He is squatting after every run he runs. Still looks strong
yorks him up, Pathan can't do much and squeezes it back
flat delivery, swatted powerfully to long-on for one
and Tiwary finds a gap, he actually rips through it, coming down the wicket and hits it so hard straight down the ground that the man at long-on has no chance
advances down again, but ends up yorking himself
bouncer, Pathan ducks under it, called one for the over

into the second tier! This man is hitting them brutally. He has missed the yorker by inches, and the low full toss is flying over long-on. And it just looks like a shovel shot in the replay, but how far has it travelled?
drives this to long-on for one
and Tiwary's brute power is now finding placement, driving - nay bludgeoning - this length delivery for four between the bowler and long-on
short ball, Tiwary swings and misses
slower ball, driven past mid-off, strong hit again, and India are one hit away now. What a turnaround
Pathan pushes this into the covers for one
full ball, on the pads, hit to midwicket
full and flat, pushed to long-off for one
and he is not tempted to finish it with a six, draws the scores level with a bunted single into the off side. Clenches the fist as he finishes the single
and Tiwary finishes this off with a six to long-on and walks into a hug with Pathan
